channel.title: Red Faction: Guerilla
channel.description: Any thoughts on the upcoming PC release? For the console owners, if there are any, was it good on the console?

item.title: Red Faction: Guerilla
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

I saw my freind playing this game on his PS3 (prick.) and it seemed pretty messy. not a game im buying. all you really are is building demolisher, which in nowadays games can mean anything.

When was the last time you played a game where you could strategically destroy every building piece by piece? The answer is never.

Read full topic

item.title: Red Faction: Guerilla
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Guf:

I got it via Steam, but have yet to get into it as it’s startup logos get stuttery, then it crashes just as it gets to (or just before) the main menu… I guess I should see if my drivers need updating or something…

I had it crash a ton before I got into the game but now that I am about 10 hours into it (I have pretty much spent my life in it for the last day), I have only had it crash once. This may or may not relate to your issue but it nevertheless should give you hope of uninterrupted destructive mayhem, something we all need from time to time.

Read full topic

item.description:
I’ve been trying to download this of Steam, but I have filters set up to only allow Steam to connect to Australian content servers, and it seems that none of them have the RF:G data yet. Same goes for B:AA and a few of the Star Wars games =[

item.title: Red Faction: Guerilla
item.dc:creator: func_random
item.description:
I had it for PS3 for about two weeks, then I sold it to a friend at my school. I really wish I hadn’t. The game is awesome, especially the multiplayer. Someone was sniping from the top of a tower during a deathmatch, and everyone below toppled the tower with team effort and he was crushed under the falling steel.
The story is decent, [COLOR=‘DimGray’]You win, Mars is freed, and Samantha is a wastelander person, who are actually the decendents of scientists and are super advanced, main mission giver is killed by EDF, and you use the power of your nano-rifle to blow a Flamberge-sized ship out of Mars airspace
Gameplay is awesome. I would head to a mission point, stop, get out of my car, and set up a trap for EDF headed my way, I raided EDF supplies, then stormed out in mining walker, I blasted the snipers at the top of the building with my X-Ray railgun, I did EVERYTHING
If you haven’t got it, get it. (unless you are Dias, in that case go back to planning how to prove everything in the world is shit.)

Read full topic

item.title: Red Faction: Guerilla
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
2.5mbs. Red Faction Guerilla is fucking sweet. Physics beat any game i’ve ever seen, gameplay and the storyline kickass right now, and the multiplayer is insane since the destruction makes everthing unpredictable.

item.title: Red Faction: Guerilla
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Dias:

I didn’t care about any of the other available weapons, and I really had no interest in it other then randomly killing people.

Not even the nano rifle that dissolves everything? Kickass gun.

The multyplayer’s pretty fun though.

Read full topic

item.title: Red Faction: Guerilla
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
Hamst3r:

From the Steam store page for Red Faction 2:

NOTE: Direct X 10.1 ATI video cards or Direct X 10.0 Nvidia video cards are not supported.

I hear there’s a mod to make it work if you have that hardware in your system.

I’ve read that Red Faction 2 was pretty bad though.

I have the mod cause I have two 4890s and it works. Red Faction 2s story and gameplay suck, but the visuals and physics engine are pretty impressive for 2003.

Read full topic
